column4: that "help" entry on the ubuntu feisty starter guide for firestarter is bogus
pelo, yeah, pretty much a nube with linux
I did some scanns and found ports set at closed, I'd like them stealthed
pelo, how hacker safe is it when set to closed?
if it's closed, that means nothing can talk to it. In fact
but with aptitude interactive, you can fix the dependency problems
could you give me some info like what is samba?
basically a way to see windows shares
ok thanks.  I don't need it actually since I don't have a windows os
ah, you are intellectually advanced, then
hahaha, not really just want to get away from what seems to be a permanent drain in the wallet.
where are you trying to start firestarter from?
the terminal, it doesn't come up from the gui
I mean, a console or a terminal on the desktop
is any other gksudo gui working, like gksudo gedit ?
strange, usually that error carries over to all gui apps
